poem:
Title: Ode to Untrodden Hallways

In the quiet fold of the morning's grey,
Flicker shadows of the pedagogue's dismay.
Ofsted's ink, a sculptor of their dread,
Crafts a chalice from which many have bled.
Cracks emerge where the stone-faced corridors weep,
In the wake of lives that the night chose to keep.
Yet beyond this mournful dirge of routine,
Surely, there seeds a resilient green.
